bug.summary: sometimes camshfit get the invalid width of return (RotatedRect)
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
OpenCV = 3.2: Operating System / Platform = win 10: Compiler = vs2013
<denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
sometimes when you use camshift to get the rectangle of object,you may get a invaild value of the rectangle's width,the vaule is -1.#IND. Obviously,there is some wrong with it. when i view the source code of camshift, i find the place that the wrong may be happen. file: sources\modules\video\src\camshift.cpp line:171 code: double width = std::sqrt( rotate_c * inv_m00 ) * 4; if we put a negative number in sqrt , the return must be -1.#IND. first inv_m00 can't be a negative number, because m00 is determined in line 150, so the only mistake should be rotate_c . i can't find out the reason can cause this situation,but if we can judge the rotate_c is a negative number may fix it.
